short_description: Converts input data to the basis generated by its principal components.
long_description: Converts input data to the basis generated by its principal components.

input_tables.name: inputtable
input_tables.rDescription: The table containing the data to be transformed.
input_tables.description: The table containing the data to be transformed.

input_tables.name: pcatable
input_tables.rDescription: The table containing the output of the ta.pca function.This table may be either old-style (with just the standard deviation) or new-style (with the proportion of variance and the cumulative variance). The function should detect which PCA output is being used.
input_tables.description: The table containing the output of the PCA_Reduce function.This table may be either old-style (with just the standard deviation) or new-style (with the proportion of variance and the cumulative variance). The function should detect which PCA output is being used.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: Components
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of principal components to return (an integer). If num_components is k, then the function returns the top k components.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of principal components to return (an integer). If num_components is k, then the function returns the top k components.
